DC Externally Excited Motor Environments¶

DC Externally Excited Base Motor¶

class gym_electric_motor.envs.gym_dcm.dcm_extex._DCMExtEx(converter_type, zero_refs=(), **kwargs)[source]¶
Description:
Environment for a DC externally excited Motor.

Observation:

Type: Dict(Box,Box,Box,Box,Box,Box)

Name Observation
omega Angular Velocity
torque Electrical Torque
i_a Armature Current
i_e Excitation Current
u_a Armature Voltage
u_e Excitation Voltage
u_sup Supply Voltage
References

References in the same order as the state variables

Action Space:
Depends on the converter and if a continuous or discrete action should be used. It is the applied voltage.
Reward:
See DCM Base Environment
Starting State:
Random initial state, that fulfills some plausibility constraints
Episode Termination:
An episode terminates, when all the steps in the reference have been simulated or limits are violated.
get_motor_param()[source]¶

This function returns all motor parameters, sampling time, safety margin and converter limits

Returns:All parameters

DC Discretely Controlled Externally Excited Motor¶

Environment ID: emotor-dc-extex-disc-v0

class gym_electric_motor.envs.gym_dcm.dcm_extex.DCMExtExDisc(converter_type='4Q', tau=1e-05, **kwargs)[source]¶

DC Continuously Controlled Externally Excited Motor¶

Environment ID: emotor-dc-extex-cont-v0

class gym_electric_motor.envs.gym_dcm.dcm_extex.DCMExtExCont(converter_type='4Q', tau=0.0001, **kwargs)[source]¶
step(action)[source]¶

Clips the action to its limits and uses the base step function

Parameters:action – desired switching state of the converter that should be applied
Returns:observation: The observation from the environment

reward: The reward for the taken action

bool: Flag if the episode has ended

info: An always empty dictionary
Return type:Tuple(array(float), float, bool, dict)
